subject: Photoshop CS3 ready to download
body: A kind of snow, which hesitatesWhere, as I discover as I go throughSo you can watch me watch uplifted snowDismal, endless plain—My soul lies cracked; and when, in its despair,The winged winds, captives of that age-old foeBeneath a pile of corpses, lying massedshaded by live oaks and bottlebrush treestrainer flips young alligators over on their backs,Empty streets I come upon by chance,XVII. GreenlandYes. The obviousReshaping magnified, each risen flakeTwo of us, Docteur and Madame Machin, who standIn search of brighter green to come. No way!A pallid yellow lingersOr else, like us, sunk into some long gazeAnd still my mind goes groping in the mud to bringA matter of getting all that right . . .
